segments.text: I can't decide whether to go to university or to get a job .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , if I were you , I'd go on studying .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But I don't even know what to study .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If I had chance again , I'd major in English . You're good at language .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's what my parents want me to do .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You should take their advice . They know what's best for you.But my friends will have jobs and lots of fun , while I spend all my time doing reading and writing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But if you go to university , you'll still have time for fun .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hm , what you say makes sense . But you know , I still have to ask my parents for pocket money , and I hate to do so at this age .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And if you try to find a part-time job , you'll have some money too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're right . Thank you for the advice .
segments.speaker: S2
